MajorClaims.MC1: more responsibilities should put on private individuals and companies such as paying to clean up air pollution
MajorClaims.MC2: both companies and private individuals should take the main part to clean up the air pollution

Claims.C1: governments are responsible to provide a healthy environment for their inhabitants and they should be responsible from cleaning up the air pollution
Claims.C2: If these companies were obliged to pay to clean up the air pollution, they would at least make an effort to reduce the amount of air pollution they cause
Claims.C3: by charging private individuals for causing air pollution, that will at least contribute to reduce the amount of the pollution
Claims.C4: governments should restrict the use of products that cause air pollution for both individuals and companies
Claims.C5: Governments also should use an amount of money from their budgets to clean up the air, instead of putting all the responsibility to companies and private individuals

Premises.P1: in most industrialized countries, there is a number of companies that holds heavy factories in their constitutions
Premises.P2: The waste products and harmful gases produced by these factories cause a significant amount of air pollution
Premises.P3: While these companies make a huge amount of money from their businesses, most of them are not considering to take precautions to reduce the amount of air pollution
Premises.P4: private individuals cause air pollution in several ways such as inessential use of cars and house heating
Premises.P5: As house heating is a major need in the winter time, some households do not consider to use filters to reduce the amount of pollution that the heating causes
Premises.P6: some expensive vehicles cause a huge amount of pollution
